ygData.subject: Re: RE: Smiths of Norrath
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes, it is hard to, when people can buy BRONZE for not much more than 1p per AC... Lemac Justerian - High Elf Cleric on Karana server Proud member of Platinum
ygData.messageBody:
Yes, it is hard to, when people can buy BRONZE for not much more than 1p per
AC...

Lemac Justerian - High Elf Cleric on Karana server
Proud member of Platinum Sphere Guild - www.platinumsphere.com



----- Original Message -----
From: Jon Blevins <jdblevins@...>
To: <EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, October 14, 1999 8:57 AM
Subject: Re: [EQ_Blacksmiths] RE: Smiths of Norrath


> From: Jon Blevins <jdblevins@...>
>
> I agree. Although I have actually been called a crook
> for selling stuff at these prices. There is one guy on
> Tunare that make and enitire suit minus the leggs for
> 70 plat. It would be nice if I could actually make a
> profit. The going price is 1plat per ac on Tunare =(
> as we have only on the RARE occassion been able to
> sell for anything higher then that without being
> openly laughed at.
>
> --- Bonecrkr <bonecrkr@...> wrote:
> > I like this idea alot. If it became widespread, it
> > would once and for all
> > shut the mouths of the assholes out there trying to
> > tell you what you should
> > charge them for banded. Lately, I've been harassed
> > by people saying (lying
> > actually) that the going rate for banded is now 1pp
> > per AC and getting real
> > upset when I tell them no. The other source of
> > misinformation comes to
> > these people when they buy a banded gorget for 2-3pp
> > from the wannabee
> > smiths that never get there skill much past 50 (you
> > people on E Marr near
> > Freeport know who I am talking about). There are
> > perhaps 5 of us really
> > active in smithing on E Marr and I know 2 of the
> > other people for sure.
> > I'll try to get in touch with them and see what they
> > think. The prices
> > esposed on the site are about 1 to 2pp higher than I
> > charge now (5pp per
> > sheet needed to make an item, 15pp for cloaks).
> >
> >
